title: Anyone Who has Climbing Experience
body:
Hey guys, this is a question for those who have good experience in climbing in ranked, since i never was able to climb myself, I was wondering how other people do it. How many hours do i have to spend on ranked daily? and what positions would be best to carry with..
-----Bronze 4 Support main

replies.body:
Check out this post I just made - https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/FPRgim2x-i-cant-seem-to-get-out-of-bronze?comment=0000

I hope it can help.
yea cheers, I'll try to use the tips its just that I have trouble (being a support) communicating with toxic team mates, as they usually always lose the game

> [{quoted}](name=terrythebeast,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=T8LiQjWM,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-09-28T07:44:09.898+0000)
>
> yea cheers, I'll try to use the tips its just that I have trouble (being a support) communicating with toxic team mates, as they usually always lose the game

not being toxic or tiltable yourself has such a HUGE impact on your win rate. Enjoy your wins, learn from your losses. Some games are worth surrendering that arent surrendered,  but plenty of surrendered games are winnable with a little patience.

Just dont be "that guy" and you might surprise yourself. I know I surprised myself when I changed my attitude.
yea I understand that attitude has some sort of impact on my performance, but how do i prepare for climbing.. I mean as in how many hours a day and what champs and positions i should use

> [{quoted}](name=terrythebeast,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=T8LiQjWM,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2017-09-28T09:15:03.281+0000)
>
> yea I understand that attitude has some sort of impact on my performance, but how do i prepare for climbing.. I mean as in how many hours a day and what champs and positions i should use

Basics would be lane / wave control (pushing waves exposes you to enemy ganks, letting them push exposes them to your ganks), last hit to maximise income, ward often to neuter attempts by enemy jg to gank, and prioritise objectives - ie is it worth more to push turret or go for cheeky dragon? If you wipe team should you smash 2 turrets or attempt baron? Learn your champs combos. And try non main champs out in norms / practice - particularly those you have trouble beating. If you know their kit, you know how to avoid them. oh and position for your role. If you are a tank you need to front line and CC the major threats. If you are a squishy you cant afford to die so where do you position yourself to maximise impact for team but minimise chance of dying?

To be honest there are a million people better able to explain strategy and tactics than me (am only silver 2). And plenty of resources exist so google is your friend here.

But I can speak from experience that my own attitude has a remarkable impact on my ability to tilt / climb.
yea i will use these techniques.. Cheers man :)

You can climb to challenger without typing a word in game (although I always recommend "gw", "gj", "ggwp"). Just remember to keep the focus on your self and learn something from every game. Never play multiple games on "autopilot" where you're just hitting that play button and not actually evaluating your own play.
Just play Soraka lmao. No one knows how to deal with her healings in bronze
Also don't die in teamfights and win
lmao i main blitz.. but i will try soraka

Don't try playing squishy roles because if you make a mistake you will die instantly, especially in bronze where everyone is bad. Toplane is a good choice because you can play tanks like Maoki and Malphite. All you have to do is use your ult to engage in teamfights then just peel for everyone.
